GOD.content: Baudelaire: to repudiate efforts of a preceding society, Christian and philosophic, is to commit suicide [St. Augustine et al. “see” only plastic] [Derrida compares this essay, “The Pagan School,” to “Counterfeit Money,” calls the former less rusé]
GOD.linkedContent: Baudelaire: to repudiate efforts of a preceding society, Christian and philosophic, is to commit suicide [St. Augustine et al. “see” only plastic] [Derrida compares this essay, “The Pagan School,” to “Counterfeit Money,” calls the former less rusé]

GT.content: counterfeit money: heart of questions of reference and difference
GT.linkedContent: counterfeit money: heart of questions of reference and difference

GT.content: counterfeiter justifies both sides, leaves the circle, mastery of reappropriation
GT.linkedContent: counterfeiter justifies both sides, leaves the circle, mastery of reappropriation

GT.content: Poe: counterfeit the presence of night (non-truth): secret survives in their artificitality
GT.linkedContent: Poe: counterfeit the presence of night (non-truth): secret survives in their artificitality

GT.content: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend
GT.linkedContent: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend

GT.content: as long as money counts, produces effects, as long as it assures finite possibilities of decision & judgment, it is simply not different from money it counterfeits > a more powerful but not infinitely powerful [?] inscription of effects of reference on truth, convention, dispositifs
GT.linkedContent: as long as money counts, produces effects, as long as it assures finite possibilities of decision & judgment, it is simply not different from money it counterfeits > a more powerful but not infinitely powerful [?] inscription of effects of reference on truth, convention, dispositifs

GT.content: opposition of conventional to natural is discredited, or, more rigorously, it is limited in its indispensable credit, in the speculation it will always have to authorize
GT.linkedContent: opposition of conventional to natural is discredited, or, more rigorously, it is limited in its indispensable credit, in the speculation it will always have to authorize

GT.content: chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods
GT.linkedContent: chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods

GT.content: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]
GT.linkedContent: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]

R.content: roué trickster deserves the wheel, respects nothing, sort of a voyou
R.linkedContent: roué trickster deserves the wheel, respects nothing, sort of a voyou

R.content: roué qualifies one who turns a trick, the voyou (rogue) w/ his leading astray (dévoiement), debauchery, worklessness, always a seduction, licentious, libertine [always men, sexual difference]
R.linkedContent: roué qualifies one who turns a trick, the voyou (rogue) w/ his leading astray (dévoiement), debauchery, worklessness, always a seduction, licentious, libertine [always men, sexual difference]

R.content: democracy always associated w/ this figure, w/ taking too many liberties, libertine, liberalism, “everything is allowed,” announces a beheading of monarchical sovereignty
R.linkedContent: democracy always associated w/ this figure, w/ taking too many liberties, libertine, liberalism, “everything is allowed,” announces a beheading of monarchical sovereignty

R.content: Jews wore the rouelle (little red & white wheel, ancestor to yellow star)
R.linkedContent: Jews wore the rouelle (little red & white wheel, ancestor to yellow star)

R.content: democracy must be public, phenomenal, something of the Enlightenment, but also it must give rights to the secret, society of the secret (voyoucracy)
R.linkedContent: democracy must be public, phenomenal, something of the Enlightenment, but also it must give rights to the secret, society of the secret (voyoucracy)

R.content: voyoucracy, corrupting power of street, not anarchic disorder, but structured disorder, secret society, seducer
R.linkedContent: voyoucracy, corrupting power of street, not anarchic disorder, but structured disorder, secret society, seducer

R.content: voyoute, extremely rare word, artificial, a bit tomboyish, free & master of her own like man, air of liberated feminist—but voyou is always a man if not a ladies’ man
R.linkedContent: voyoute, extremely rare word, artificial, a bit tomboyish, free & master of her own like man, air of liberated feminist—but voyou is always a man if not a ladies’ man

R.content: voyou-cracy a counterconcept of sovereignty like we find in Bataille
R.linkedContent: voyou-cracy a counterconcept of sovereignty like we find in Bataille

R.content: rogue unlike voyou [in French] can be animal, a creature incapable of mingling w/ the herd
R.linkedContent: rogue unlike voyou [in French] can be animal, a creature incapable of mingling w/ the herd

R.content: the rogue that therefore I am: (ab)using time

POOF.content: for Kant, crime against humanity would be to disdain currency, to take counterfeit money for counterfeit [skeptic betrays mankind] > for Kant, virtue obligates that we turn counterfeit (small change) into gold, becoming-truth of the simulacrum, its verification, authentication [pp. 257-58 rare friend keeps secret, renounces possible public profit, that of circulating secret]
POOF.linkedContent: for Kant, crime against humanity would be to disdain currency, to take counterfeit money for counterfeit [skeptic betrays mankind] > for Kant, virtue obligates that we turn counterfeit (small change) into gold, becoming-truth of the simulacrum, its verification, authentication [pp. 257-58 rare friend keeps secret, renounces possible public profit, that of circulating secret]

PS.content: for Artaud, “the metaphor of myself is my dispossession w/in language” > this by way of the counterfeiter, God–Satan, who isn’t a creator, but the subject of all [dispossessing] oeuvres
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, “the metaphor of myself is my dispossession w/in language” > this by way of the counterfeiter, God–Satan, who isn’t a creator, but the subject of all [dispossessing] oeuvres

LI.content: dispatch should have been signed, which I do, and counterfeit, here, where? [Remark at end of SEC, also see GT]
LI.linkedContent: dispatch should have been signed, which I do, and counterfeit, here, where? [Remark at end of SEC, also see GT]

CIN.content: [Derrida on his own “counterfeiter’s forgery,” on his ability to lie, or not be certain what he knows, but what does he know or lie about w/ such indeterminate phrases?]
CIN.linkedContent: [Derrida on his own “counterfeiter’s forgery,” on his ability to lie, or not be certain what he knows, but what does he know or lie about w/ such indeterminate phrases?]

BSi.content: Rousseau confesses: I lived like a werewolf (loup-garou) (outlaw, savage) because I read
BSi.linkedContent: Rousseau confesses: I lived like a werewolf (loup-garou) (outlaw, savage) because I read

BSi.content: for Rousseau, outlaw is “w/out faith or law”
BSi.linkedContent: for Rousseau, outlaw is “w/out faith or law”

CIR.content: I’m a dying counterfeiter, lie permanently to everyone, will never reveal full grain of transgressions we’re dying to know, archive [SA on temptation of curiosity, knowledge]; skizzolatry in notebook, colonize and cultivate hell, escarre as sponge; SA accuses/praises God for being monster mother, infinite sea containing finite sponge [this is prior to SA’s conversion]
CIR.linkedContent: I’m a dying counterfeiter, lie permanently to everyone, will never reveal full grain of transgressions we’re dying to know, archive [SA on temptation of curiosity, knowledge]; skizzolatry in notebook, colonize and cultivate hell, escarre as sponge; SA accuses/praises God for being monster mother, infinite sea containing finite sponge [this is prior to SA’s conversion]

SPEC.content: Nietzsche achieved findings of psychoanalysis w/out pain, using counterfeit coins? Freud’s évitement, avertissement
SPEC.linkedContent: Nietzsche achieved findings of psychoanalysis w/out pain, using counterfeit coins? Freud’s évitement, avertissement

SPEC.content: Freud’s avoidance of philosophy [of Nietzsche] (already in place like a counterfeiter) is inevitable (closest avoided in inevitable itself) > that the da be fort even before a judgment of denegation vienne y apposer la spécificité de son sceau
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s avoidance of philosophy [of Nietzsche] (already in place like a counterfeiter) is inevitable (closest avoided in inevitable itself) > that the da be fort even before a judgment of denegation vienne y apposer la spécificité de son sceau

SPEC.content: for Freud, one can inherit conceptual simulacra, counterfeit money [Nietzsche, Schopenhauer], but it is lacking in guaranteed value of psychoanalysis > Freud’s rationalization, his naive self-assurance re: counterfeit money, a scene of intolerable inheritance
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, one can inherit conceptual simulacra, counterfeit money [Nietzsche, Schopenhauer], but it is lacking in guaranteed value of psychoanalysis > Freud’s rationalization, his naive self-assurance re: counterfeit money, a scene of intolerable inheritance

FV.content: Poe: “the sable divinity would not herself dwell with us always; but we could counterfeit her presence”
FV.linkedContent: Poe: “the sable divinity would not herself dwell with us always; but we could counterfeit her presence”
